The main event in this scenario is the experience of feeling confident and positive about oneself, only to be criticized or told something negative by someone close, which can lead to feelings of worthlessness and self-doubt.

"I'm so tired of feeling like I'm not good enough. Every time I start to feel confident, someone else tells me that I'm wrong or that I messed up. It's like they're trying to bring me down and make me feel worthless. I can't keep living like this."

In this post, the individual is attributing the cause of their negative emotions (feeling worthless and self-doubt) to a stable factor - the criticism or negative feedback they receive from someone close. They believe that this feedback is a reflection of their inherent flaws and that they are fundamentally not good enough, leading to a stable attributional style.
